Add or update food tax rate. Only one food tax rate is allowed per business. If food tax rate exists, it will be updated; otherwise, it will be created.
Update existing food tax rate by ID.

Create a new order. Returns order_id and order_ticket_id to use in Step 6.

Resume an existing order by order_ticket_id. Validates that the employee_id matches the order's creator. If employee doesn't match, returns error 'It's not your order'. Use this to access an order that was previously created.

Move entire order (with all merged tables) to a new table. All previously merged tables will be released and made available. The order number stays the same, only the table name in order_ticket_title changes.

Replace a specific table in merged tables. Only the targeted table (old_table_id) will be replaced with new_table_id. Other merged tables remain unchanged. Useful when you want to swap one table in a merged group.

Merge multiple table orders into one order. You can pass an array of table IDs to merge. All order items from merged orders will be combined into the first/main order. The order_ticket_title will include all merged table names (e.g., 20251103-01T1T3 or 20251103-01T1T2T3).
Send order items to kitchen. Accepts multiple items. If called again, only adds new items (no deletion). Note: Use order_id and order_ticket_id from Step 5 response.
Update all order items with fire_status = 0 to fire_status = 1 for a given order.
Update the sequence (priority) of a specific order item. Lower sequence number = higher priority. Used for drag-and-drop reordering in the status screen.
Process payment for an order. Marks the check as paid, updates order status to completed, and sets table status to available. Prevents further modifications to the order.

REAL PRODUCTION: Creates a Stripe Payment Intent with card_present for REAL tap/insert/swipe payments at physical terminals.

 Flow:
1. Call this endpoint to create payment intent
2. Flutter app uses client_secret with Stripe Terminal SDK
3. Customer taps/inserts/swipes card on physical terminal
4. Call 'Confirm Payment' endpoint after successful tap

 Requirements:
- Stripe Terminal hardware or NFC-enabled device
- Employee authentication token required
- Updates database (order, check, payment)

 IMPORTANT: Currency must match your Stripe account country (US  usd, UK  gbp, EU  eur).

 For testing without hardware, use 'STRIPE DEMO API' section instead.

REAL PRODUCTION: Confirms payment after REAL card tap on physical terminal.

 Flow:
1. Customer taps card on Stripe Terminal
2. Stripe SDK processes payment
3. Call this endpoint to verify and update database

 What it does:
- Verifies payment with Stripe
- Creates Payment record
- Updates Check status to 'paid'
- Updates Order status to 'completed'
- Releases Table (sets to 'available')

 Requires: Employee authentication token
 Use payment_intent_id from 'Create Payment Intent' response.

REAL PRODUCTION: Check the status of a payment intent without processing it.

 Use cases:
- Verify payment status before confirming
- Check if payment succeeded
- Debug payment issues

 Requires: Employee authentication token

REAL PRODUCTION: Create connection token for Stripe Terminal hardware card readers.

 Flow:
1. Call this endpoint to get connection token
2. Flutter app uses secret to connect to Terminal
3. Terminal is ready to accept card taps

 Requirements:
- Stripe Terminal hardware device
- Employee authentication token required

 This is for REAL physical card readers, not simulation.

TEST MODE: Create and process payment with card number (for testing without physical card reader).

 Use Stripe test cards:
- Success: 4242 4242 4242 4242
- Declined: 4000 0000 0000 0002
- Insufficient: 4000 0000 0000 9995

 Test Card Details:
- Card: 4242 4242 4242 4242
- Expiry: 12/29 (exp_month: 12, exp_year: 2029)
- CVC: 123

 This endpoint automatically confirms and processes payment if successful. Perfect for testing tap payment flow in sandbox mode.
Release a table by setting its status to 'available'. Use this to manually free up a table without completing an order.

item.name: STRIPE DEMO API
item.description: Demo Stripe payment endpoints - No authentication required. Perfect for testing Stripe integration.

request.description:
DEMO: Create Payment Intent with card_present for tap/insert/swipe payments. No authentication required. Uses automatic capture.

 IMPORTANT: Currency must match your Stripe account country:
- US accounts: Use 'usd' only
- UK accounts: Use 'gbp' only
- EU accounts: Use 'eur' only
DEMO: Check payment status. No authentication required. Use payment_intent_id from Create Payment Intent response.

DEMO: Simulate card tap payment with test card. Complete payment cycle for testing.

 STEP 1: First call 'Demo - Create Payment Intent' to get payment_intent_id
 STEP 2: Then call this endpoint with the payment_intent_id and test card details

 Stripe Test Cards:
- Success: 4242 4242 4242 4242
- Declined: 4000 0000 0000 0002
- Insufficient: 4000 0000 0000 9995

 Test Card Details (Default):
- Card: 4242 4242 4242 4242
- Expiry: 12/29 (exp_month: 12, exp_year: 2029)
- CVC: 123

 No authentication required. No database connection. Pure Stripe testing.

DEMO: Refund a successful payment. Complete refund cycle for testing.

 STEP 1: Create payment intent
 STEP 2: Process payment with test card
 STEP 3: Refund the payment using this endpoint

 Refund Options:
- Full refund: Don't include 'amount' field
- Partial refund: Include 'amount' field (e.g., 50.00)

 Refund Reasons:
- duplicate: Duplicate transaction
- fraudulent: Fraudulent transaction
- requested_by_customer: Customer requested refund

 No authentication required. No database connection. Pure Stripe testing.
DEMO: Create connection token for Stripe Terminal. No authentication required. Flutter app uses this secret to connect to Terminal readers for card_present payments.
